results.title: Senior Product Manager, Ground
results.description:
About DroneDeploy
We’re the leading drone software provider making commercial drone data accessible to anyone, anywhere. Trusted by users across various industries, we’re transforming how businesses collect, manage, and analyze worksite data. Our user-friendly platform makes it possible for companies of any size to improve their workflows through scalable image processing, data storage, and real-time sharable drone maps and 3D models. 
 
We are committed to a global work environment that empowers employees to innovate, grow professionally, and make meaningful impacts. We’re recognized as a # 1 Best Place to Work in the SF Bay Area and have made the Top 200 list of America’s Best Startups. Our employees are creative, driven, and committed to providing our customers with the best drone software in the industry. Our office locations include San Francisco, California | Sydney, Australia | Auckland, New Zealand.
 
Role Overview
This role can be worked 100% remotely or in a hybrid manner from our San Francisco Office.
 
DroneDeploy’s product & engineering team works to bring game-changing computer vision technology to market to improve safety and efficiency for every job site. Over 1 Million datasets are uploaded to our platform each year, with 3D Aerial and Ground data being generated in over 200 countries worldwide. DroneDeploy’s product team is highly customer-focused, and you should expect to spend a lot of time with our customers, including travel to job sites. You’ll develop your own product vision and a strategy that will make the largest possible impact on the market.
 
We are looking for an experienced product manager to join our Ground data team to own the web experience on our StructionSite & Walkthrough platforms, accelerating DroneDeploy’s business in the Construction and Energy industries. You will be responsible for our web strategy, prioritizing the most pressing problems for our customers, and developing the right tools and workflows that provide the most impactful solutions. You’ll deliver intuitive user experiences that delight and engage customers. DroneDeploy’s Ground product is our fastest growing and you will need to work cross-functionally across product, engineering, sales, and marketing to deliver on the massive growth opportunity.



Responsibilities
  • Develop product strategy & roadmap for our StructionSite and Walkthrough products, in partnership with the Director Of Product - Ground.
  • Deeply understand our customers and prospects in the Construction and Energy Verticals. Learn about and clearly document their goals & frustrations. Educate the team on your research. 
  • Partner closely with your partners in Design and Engineering, delivering pragmatic solutions that drive significant value for customers. You’ll be contributing to strategy across multiple teams, investing about $2-3M of developer time each year.
  • Lead product decisions on priorities, help resolve issues and develop and communicate your roadmap to the company and your team.
  • Develop a clear revenue growth plan, and contribute to our packaging approach. Help the Go to Market team to focus their efforts.
  • Lead high-level relationships with strategic partners where they connect to your product.
  • Own the delivery of the product through launch, customer acquisition, adoption, activity, and long-term iteration and improvements.



Requirements
  • 4+ years experience in building SAAS products.
  • Day-to-day experience as a Product Owner in an agile environment with a dedicated development team.
  • Experience delivering full-stack product features to customers.
  • Comfortable seeking and using product usage tracking or operational data & data analysis tools to drive product decisions.
  • Able to work between Monday - Friday, 8-5 pm PST.
  • Available to travel domestically and internationally occasionally for work-related events such as conferences, customer meetings, company in-person gatherings, pieces of training, and other business needs.
  • BONUS: Experience using UI/UX tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Zeplin.io
#LI-Remote
 
Employee Offerings & Benefits include:
(may vary by location)
Innovative company culture
Drone pilot certification
Flexible work schedules
Flexible work location
Family paid leave
Paid healthcare for employees
Professional development & career advancements
Wellbeing activities (live & on-demand)
Flexible paid time off
Employee referral bonus
Commuter savings
 
DroneDeploy is an equal opportunity employer.
 
All DroneDeploy employees are responsible for assisting in protecting the company and customer data by following information security policies and procedures.
 
Please refer to our Recruitment Privacy Notice for information about privacy during the recruiting process.

results.title: Head of Product
results.description:
Head of Product

Who is Serotonin?

Serotonin is the leading breakthrough marketing and communications partner for digital asset companies, working with the top businesses and entrepreneurs in the industry on brand positioning, media relations, content, growth marketing, and go-to-market strategy. We bring together a deep expertise in financial services, digital assets, and decentralizing technologies to help innovators tackle some of the biggest challenges facing business and society by building the next generation of products, services, and experiences.

About the role.

Serotonin is seeking an experienced Head of Product to build Serotonin’s next product. This person will work with the key stakeholders and develop this product from 0-1. This Head of Product will identify, hire, and manage their team to ensure the long term success of this product. The ideal candidate should have 6-10+ years of experience building products from inception to launch for early and growth-stage technology companies; and should be well versed in fintech and/or web3 technology. 

Responsibilities

  • Own the vision, strategy, roadmap, and delivery for Serotonin’s next product. 
  • Develop a deep understanding of all stakeholders - leadership, founders, and other community members - and how to incentivize growth of a flywheel among them.
  • Partner effectively with other internal stakeholders internally to influence priorities and drive alignment
  • Monitor project execution and ensure that the project delivery is to the appropriate levels of quality and in line with target dates
  • Hire, mentor, and retain a team of high-performing professionals
  • Ability to drive out clarity from ambiguity and thrive (opportunity, vision, strategy, roadmap, go-to-market)
  • Consistently executes on fast feedback loops (build, measure, learn)
  • Works closely with customers and adjacent internal teams (marketing, legal, etc) to produce positive outcomes
  • Conduct market research to develop a deep understanding of our users' needs and to conceptualize new updates/features that customers will want.
  • Conduct customer interviews and present key metrics to leadership to track product performance.

Requirements:

  • 6-10 years experience in a leadership product management role. 
  • A proven track record of successful 0-1 product launches.
  • Crypto/web3 native
  • Technologist by experience or education; comfortable communicating high-level benefits and digging into the technical weeds
  • Exceptional and excellent communication skills, both written and spoken
  • Experience working remotely with a globally distributed team

Bonus:

  • Experience working in a fast-paced start-up or agency environment
  • Experience working with emergent technology brands and businesses

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Remote, Bratislava
3000 - 5000 EUR/m
Place of work: Remote or office in Bratislava
Type: Full-time, contract
 
About us
Surglogs is a health technology startup that broke through the US market. In less than two years, we have managed to digitize processes for hundreds of surgery centers and hospitals in 47 states in the US. Our platform streamlines the management of medical forms, drug consumption, and employees.
If you are interested in working on the development of our product and want to see the actual results of your work, read on. We are looking for bright people with excellent communication, a pro-customer approach, and a desire to build relationships with our clients.
 
Let our CTO tell you more about your role:
Hi, our future Product Manager👋! I'm Jakub, Co-Founder, and CTO of Surglogs.
I believe that great Product Management is key to building a successful product.
That’s why your role will be crucial for the whole company. 
You will report directly to me and have all the responsibility and freedom you need.
 
You will work with an autonomous product team and manage the product lifecycle from discovery and design to development and launch.
 
Problems create space for innovation. First, you must love and understand the problem, not the solution. Generally, there are only four key contributions you need to bring to your team:
 
- Deep Knowledge of our Customer
- Deep Knowledge of the Data
- Deep Knowledge of our Business and Key Stakeholders
- Deep Knowledge of our Market and Industry
 
I want you to become an expert on our product, users, and customers.
Share what you learn with the team and become a go-to person for the team and the company if someone wants better to understand our product, customers, and their problems.
Honestly said, I need someone who will nurture a strong collaborative and continuous improvement environment, work really hard with the assigned product team, and finally deliver the best ideas to our customers, which will be well aligned with business goals and constraints and will fit all market and industry needs and requirements.
 
You could be a great fit if 
- you have x years of experience with tech product development (ideally Healthcare SaaS)
- you have excellent knowledge of continuous delivery processes
- you have excellent communication and leadership skills
- you have experience with product discovery techniques
- you have experience with prioritization techniques
- you have knowledge of OKRs and their impact on product management
- you have the desire to be the best
 
🦄Benefits and Culture
We are not building teams but friendships.
At Surglogs, culture is essential to us. We help skilled people to excel and take their work to the next level.
 
We offer the following benefits:
- ability to work remotely (anywhere in the world). Yes, companies usually say that but we really mean it. We believe in determination and skills, not location.
- possibility to co-own the company (stock options)
- freedom and flexibility. We don’t clock in and out. We are interested in results, not long approvals and processes. 
- education allowance
- bookclub, internal meetups, company retreats, our awesome merch, and much more

results.title: Product Manager, B2B Experiences
results.description:
Founded in 2018, with employees across the world, The Block is the leading research, analysis, and news brand in the digital asset space. The Block's team is spread across 5 continents and 15+ time zones, covering the global cryptocurrency space 24/7. 

The Block delivers deep insight into how the emerging digital assets sector interacts with traditional finance, technology, governments, and markets. We reach hundreds of thousands of technologists, financial market participants, Fortune 500 professionals, global service providers, policymakers, and more through our main website, dedicated Research Portal, podcast, and events. 

As a Product Manager – B2B Experiences at The Block, you will lead the evolution of the business focused Pro product. You will lead the Pro team, support in creating product processes, and drive product strategy for our B2B offerings. The Product Manager will be tasked with managing a product that touches nearly every department within the company 

You will report to the Associate Director - Product, who will work with you to set the Product strategy and vision for the Pro team. The responsibilities for this role will include managing the Pro platform, partnering with various teams such as Editorial and Research to build out functionalities within Pro, and partnering with Marketing and Sales to push awareness and engagement of The Block Pro. The Product Manager will be expected to be the expert on our user base and market fit. 

The hiring range for this role is $110,000 - $140,000 in base salary, plus equity and benefits. Base salary pay within the provided range will be refined based on candidate’s experience and location.


You will:
  • Partner closely with leaders from design and engineering to build high-quality experiences at scale 
  • Lead the strategy and roadmap for the B2B product lines 
  • Know your audience inside and out, while being the evangelist internally for our users
  • Evolve the Pro News, Pro Data, and Pro Research product 
  • Collaborate with Sales and Account Management to truly understand our customers and the value proposition of our products 
  • Partner cross functionally with the stakeholders of each of your supported product lines 
  • Collaborate with the VP, Product to develop companywide product processes 
  • Individually contribute when required to meet deadlines 
  • Support B2C product team on their product initiatives 
  • Be obsessed with the competitive landscape and strive to identify gaps between our products and theirs. 
  • Build out world class systems to support our editorial and marketing teams 
  • Lead brainstorming and ideation sessions with stakeholders across the company 
  • Contribute to the culture of quality, healthy collaboration and leading by example 


Qualifications:
  • Experience with B2B product development 
  • Experience in building out scaled newsletter products 
  • Understanding of complex data infrastructures – Ability to synthesize into user friendly interfaces 
  • Ability to carry out work from concept to production 
  • Experience in working collaboratively 
  • Responds well to feedback and critiques 


The following are not required, but are nice to have:
  • Experience in conducting user interviews and user testing 
  • Knowledge of WordPress 
  • Strong relationships with design and engineering teams in past work environments 
  • Experience working with front-end coding technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript) 
  • Experience working with component-based libraries 
  • Experience with Video Player products 
  • Interest in digital assets, crypto, and blockchain technologies 
  • Experience with data and analytics 
Who We Are: The culture of The Block lies in our key behaviors. It’s who we are and it’s how we show up everyday.

We are confidently humble. We jump in and roll up our sleeves. We know there’s always more to learn and we operate without egos.
We are actionably curious. We strive to be an expert in our field and always seek opportunities to expand our knowledge and skill set. We put our learnings into practice every day. 
We practice tenacious ownership. Every day when we show up we are contributors, teammates, and owners. We rotate through those three hats with agility and without sacrificing accountability or consistency.
We practice respectful partnership. We treat others as we’d expect to be treated - with respect, concern, understanding, and patience.

Why You Should Work Here:

We take care of our employees and we have the benefits and perks to support it. Our full-time, US based employees are eligible for Unlimited PTO, remote first environment, high health plan employer contributions, monthly wellness stipend, generous parental leave policy, 401k match, fitness partnerships, fertility benefits, One Medical membership and Citibike membership. 

We’re a remote first company which allows us to hire the best person for the job regardless of location. 

Impactful work. Regardless of your role at The Block you’re making a meaningful contribution to our mission in accelerating the evolution of financial systems through independent reporting and technical research of all projects influencing the future of financial services.

What Else Should You Know?

The Block is an equal employment opportunity employer.  Qualified candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

During our application process we collect completely anonymous diversity information. Providing this information is voluntary but we want you to know what we do with it. We use the data to ensure that our recruiting practices are bringing diverse talent to the organization and we are reacting where we are coming up short. We strive to use the data to ensure we have the tools and resources for all employees both during the interview process and should those employees choose to join us at The Block.

results.title: Director of Product Development
results.description:
Onebrief makes military planning seamless and represents a shift in paradigm for future military decisions. It is an all-in-one tool that supports both the creative and process-oriented aspects of military planning. In Onebrief, planners use maps, boards, diagrams, timelines, spreadsheets, slide decks and text documents to create their plans—all while sharing a common database. Everything stays in sync, in real time. Our approach has been refined and validated through hundreds of user experiments.

We’re post-revenue ($3M+ in ARR). We are backed by Y Combinator (S21) and top-tier VCs, including Caffeinated Capital (Affirm, Docker, Notion, and more). Our elite team combines the best of tech and military talent, including education and experience at Google, Adobe, MIT, Delta Force, TOPGUN, and more.

Given our current traction we can barely keep up with demand. This is an opportunity for you to join us with all the perks of a founding employee.

What you will achieve

As a Director of Product Development, your primary responsibility will be to shape our product bets before they are scheduled for implementation. Starting with opportunities identified with our leadership team, you will refine the problem definition, design a high-level solution, mitigate risks and assumption, and establish hard “no-gos,” to make sure that the project can be executed successfully with virtually no risk to schedule.

Shaped bets are rough and unfinished, but they are painstakingly thought through. All the main elements of the solution are there at the macro level and they connect together. The work isn’t specified down to individual tasks, but the overall solution is spelled out. While surprises might still happen, any open questions or rabbit holes we could see up front have been removed to reduce the project’s risk. Shaping bets involves equal parts of product, design and engineering work.

You will have the opportunity to travel and partner with military planners from around the world, empathize with their needs, and translate that into informed product bets. You will collaborate often with leadership, engineering, and design.

This is a critical position, with significant impact.

You will report directly to Rafa, our CTO and co-founder.

About You

The ideal candidates are curious and pragmatic “product people” who understand how software products are built from having done it themselves, either as software engineers or “full-stack” designers.

We are especially interested in candidates who have led product initiatives working on B2B/SaaS projects, involving aspects of creative support, data visualization, or modern collaboration.

Qualifications

  • You have been involved in the building of software products for several years

  • You have led impactful product initiatives, even if Product Manager is not your job title

  • You have a comprehensive understanding of the current state of web technologies and best practices

  • You are naturally inclined to apply a design thinking approach to problem solving, and iteratively seek to understand your users, challenge assumptions, redefine problems and create innovative solutions which you can prototype and test

  • You work effectively with designers and engineers, leading with context, setting clear expectations, and seeking pragmatic solutions

  • You have the skills to create simple solutions for complex problems quickly; often benefiting from tried-and-true techniques

  • You put user value before tech

  • You learn quickly, work iteratively and naturally seek collaboration

  • You communicate clearly and succinctly

  • You are a U.S. citizen

  • Finally, you are a manager of one—capable of setting your own direction, building something from scratch, and seeing it through

About Us

Our team shares a passion, seek excellence, and play to win, with the seriousness and camaraderie of an olympic team. We are in this together, not just because Onebrief will one day be 10x the size of Palantir. We are here to build the future of military decisions, so that the coming decades don’t repeat the previous ones.

Here’s what our team members value most about working here:

  • Founders' transparency

  • Product and vision

  • Leadership's ability to learn and adapt

  • Challenges and learning opportunities

  • Ownership and autonomy

  • No non-sense policies and procedures

  • Remote-first, as opposed to remote-friendly

What's in it for you

  • $170k - $220k salary/year

  • Equity

  • Remote work, flex time, and unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, vision, and life insurance

  • 401k

  • Parental leave

results.title: Product Manager, Payments
results.description:
About Us


At Pagos, we’re passionate about empowering businesses to take control of their payments stack and solve the puzzles standing between them and optimized growth. Our global platform provides developers, product teams, and payments leaders with both a deeper understanding of their payments data and access to new payments technology through user-friendly tools that are easy to implement. To succeed in this, we need creative thinkers who are willing to roll up their sleeves and start building alongside us.

 

About the Role

In this role, you’ll play a key part in building our payments intelligence products. This role owns the end-to-end design and delivery of new product features and execution against the product roadmap. 

Pagos Product Managers partner closely with Engineering, Data Science, Design, Content Management and various customer-facing teams to support product implementation and perpetuate a customer-centric mindset.

As a Product Manager, you will:

  • Create and execute actionable product plans with a high level of ownership and visibility

  • Manage a sprint cadence and output in conjunction with machine learning engineering team and data scientist product managers

  • Collaborate with Design and Content Management to create intuitive user paths within the product UI and support content for self help

  • Work closely with Sales and Account Management to lead with the customer in mind

 

What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for someone with:

  • 5+ years of professional experience as a product manager and/or consultant within the fintech industry

  • Experience with building or managing predictive or statistics-based products and/or models

  • Comfort navigating, visualizing, and understanding relational data

  • Excellent communication skills—both written and verbal with the ability to influence and align cross functional groups to drive results

  • Proven ability to manage complex timelines and deliver high quality results 

  • A bias for action, where no task is too small 

  • A diligent focus on customer experience and outcomes

 

Nice to haves: 

  • Business intelligence background

  • Experience in the consumer finance industry

  • SQL experience

results.title: VP of Product
results.description:
About Us

Qualio is on a mission to empower life science teams to launch and scale life-saving products. We’re doing that by building a connected and integrated quality management platform for the entire life science ecosystem. Qualio is trusted by 100s of highly regulated international customers, ranging from the bleeding edge of computational biology and machine learning to household names in mRNA vaccine development.

The Qualio team is all-remote and currently distributed across North America and Europe.

What’s the opportunity?

We are looking for a VP of Product to build and lead a world-class product organization. The mission of the VP of Product is to own the product vision for Qualio and take responsibility for translating it to our roadmap and from there to our customers. When successful, you will be an instrumental part in enabling 100,000 teams to launch life-saving products and medicines, powered by Qualio.

What will I be doing?
  • Set the vision for the Product Management team and take a leading role in setting the vision of the company, providing strategic direction for the product, and influencing the direction of other groups in Qualio
  • Implementing/maintaining clear product metrics that enable us to understand customer engagement and opportunities to improve the product
  • Identify opportunities to build products/features that take advantage of product-led growth
  • Improve our product ideation and prioritization process to be the market leader, as measured by high customer adoption, engagement, satisfaction, and retention, and partner with engineering to deliver on the roadmap
  • Create metrics representing business performance and customer satisfaction and use those metrics to drive behavior and make data-driven decisions
  • Define the value proposition of the Product Management team and represent that value to stakeholders through the delivery of appropriate metrics and performance indicators that measure progress against your strategy
  • Challenge existing standards of product excellence and propose new standards continuously
  • Create a culture of continuous, systematic improvement within the Product Management team
  • Anticipate potential sources of failure, drive improvements to existing product features, and create new ones to overcome any setbacks
Requirements - What skills do I need?
  • 10+ years experience in product management in B2B cloud SaaS applications
  • Passion for leading, mentoring, and scaling product teams to reach their full potential
  • A healthy level of skepticism and an analytical nature with the ability to quickly absorb and analyze unfamiliar information to make decisions that are supported by sound evidence
  • Prioritization and decision-making in complex situations with competing inputs
  • Ability to see and communicate the big picture in an inspiring way
  • Experience designing and building metrics for product engagement and customer satisfaction
  • Experience managing feature sets and requirements in a complex domain or marketplace
  • Experience developing software products in a regulated space, subject to the constraints and norms of the industry
Benefits 
  • Competitive salary
  • Matching 401k
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
  • Dependent & Health FSA, Short/Long Term Disability, Basic & Voluntary Life Insurance
  • Unlimited PTO policy
  • Company allowance for home office supplies
  • 12 weeks of paid parental leave
  • Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products get to market

results.title: Principal Product Manager, Analytics
results.description:
Our growing Product Team is looking for a humble and hungry Principal Product Manager to help lead our Analytics, DataLake, and Reporting experiences. These products provide invaluable insight and actionable information for finance, project management, and leadership users of our feature-rich and open Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) platform.  

You will contribute to the strategic vision and own the delivery of our analytics and reporting solutions. With over 3,500 customers and a robust partner network, your actions and contributions will have far-reaching impacts on our project-based ERP software offering. 

What You'll Do 

  • Develop a deep understanding of user personas across business lines; leverage the same to be the sounding board for internal and external stakeholders and customers
  • Collaborate and contribute to building and updating our product roadmap for analytics, reporting, and DataLake
  • Transition proof-of-concepts to production-ready features
  • Partner with numerous stakeholders and cross-functional teams to execute our roadmap, including sprint planning and objective prioritization of features and issues
  • Become a Unanet go-to product expert; guide your scrum teams in troubleshooting production-escalation issues with your team leadership skills; train internal and external customers on new product features, capabilities, data objects, and integrations
  • Set your engineering team up for success in sprint activities, providing them with relevant user stories and guiding them in estimation
  • Reduce friction in our Agile processes when the situation calls for adjustments or changes in both the sprint and the overall strategic plan

Your First 90 Days 

In your First 30 Days, you will grow in your understanding of Unanet through the lens of our current product offerings. You will learn what is slated to be delivered over the coming two (2) quarters. With this knowledge, you will help clarify and realign existing requirements, writing epics and user stories as well as refining them with your team.  

In your First 60 Days, you will build relationships with internal and external stakeholders and help them understand our product direction and the reasoning behind it. You will understand the strategic direction of your product as well as related Unanet products and how they all work together. In partnership with your Group Product Manager and our User Experience Team, you will question, redefine, revalidate and solidify our roadmap deliverables based on your expertise and learnings. 

In your First 90 Days, you will drive our release and Go-to-Market (GTM) plan for the Analytics product deliverables. You will use the Analytics product roadmap to make commitments, evaluate client suggestions, and define metrics for adoption and engagement. You will be the guiding light for your scrum teams, helping them execute on the committed product deliverables.  

Who You Are 

  • 7+ years of B2B SaaS product management experience in an Agile environment
  • Prior experience working with analytics, data visualization, BI tooling, accounting, financials, government contracting (GovCon), or financial reporting
  • Product strategist with ability to align vision to defined outcomes
  • Strong ability to capture, detail, and explain market and technical requirements
  • Strong technical writing and visualization skills
  • Demonstrable ability to understand and evaluate customer and end-user needs
  • Depth of experience planning and supporting multi-functional web applications in production, with deploying new products and major functionality
  • Ability to identify gaps, program risks and proactively address them
  • Bias for action and execution on both short- and long-term strategic product plans

Your Differentiators 

  • Prior experience working with ERP financials and/or have an accounting background

Our Values 

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.
  • We do the right thing and have fun in the process.

The salary range for this opportunity is $140,000 – 160,000 per year. You will be eligible for employee equity as well as discretionary bonus compensation, subject to plans that may be in effect from time to time. You will further be eligible to participate in Unanet's employee benefits plans and programs. For more details on Unanet's benefits offerings, please visit https://unanet.com/employee-benefits. 

Unanet is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for positions without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Product Owner

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Description: 

Shift5 is seeking a full-time Product Manager, with a specific focus on our DoD customers, to join our growing team. In this role, you’ll have an opportunity to make an immediate impact on real world operations and problems we’re solving for our customers. You’ll learn about capability gaps in existing defense platforms, engage with customers and users, synthesize and analyze feedback, and build the product infrastructure to support our goals. Your primary responsibilities will be to act as the voice of the customer while supporting our product vision and strategy.

We are looking for someone who thrives while working in partnership with engineers, designers, and other stakeholders. The ability to translate complex technical scenarios into simplified stories and requirements is absolutely essential for this role. We operate in a fast-paced environment with competing and evolving priorities and you’ll be expected to do the same. The ideal candidate for this position is someone who is comfortable living in ambiguity and can self prioritize and self direct daily tasks and requirements. If this sounds like you, drop us a line because we’d love to hear from you.

Shift5 is a rapidly growing data and cybersecurity scale-up. We specialize in capturing and analyzing serial bus data in real time, providing anomaly detection and operational intelligence required to act. Our insights provide real-time alerting and historical trends to assure mission readiness and cyber survivability, and our innovative technology enables military systems to deter adversaries, protect warfighters, and maintain their competitive edge. We are a collaborative, passionate and driven cadre of cyber security experts. Our engineers are multidisciplinary, and our team is dynamic. We’re a growing company focused on helping our customer’s fleets run smarter and safer by capitalizing on mountains of data resting right about the wheels. Come join us.

In this role you will be expected to:

  • Identify, explore and learn about gaps in defense capabilities, engage with customers and users, synthesize and analyze feedback, and build a product infrastructure to support our goals
  • Define solutions
  • Identify and define potential features that will accelerate Shift5’s goals
  • Set clear outcomes for your area of responsibility in partnership with  engineering, design and other key stakeholders
  • Effectively communicate product vision and strategy
  • Proactively communicate goals to stakeholders and manage delivery expectations
  • Work hands-on to deliver new capabilities across the lifecycle of the product, from initial release and implementation, through up-keep and day to day improvements
  • Collaborate with Sales and Marketing to communicate product capabilities to customers and other key stakeholders

We're looking for someone who is/has:

  • BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or you’re technically savvy enough to ask engineers good questions about architecture decisions and understand the answers
  • 3+ years experience implementing and/or supporting software development or enterprise network capabilities, with specific experience in a hands-on product management role
  • Demonstrated ability to work with internal and external stakeholders across a wide range of technical comfort
  • Demonstrated experience turning conflicting or incomplete ideas into concrete action plans
  • At least a baseline understanding and experience working with DoD platforms and systems, experience within DoD fleet maintenance is a plus
  • Experience and understanding of non standard network serial protocols such as MIL STD-1553, J-1939, CANBUS and/or ARINC 429, is a huge plus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.
  • US Citizenship
  • Active (or ability to hold/obtain) a US Government Top Secret security clearance

Compensation & Benefits:

  • Employer-paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their families
  • Health Savings Account with annual employer contributions
  • 401k with employer contributions
  • Employer-paid Life Insurance
  • Uncapped paid time off policy

  • Tax-deferred public transit benefits with Metro SmartBenefits (DC/MD/VA)

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that embraces the diversity of our people and represents the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems. We strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

results.title: Associate Product Manager - Scanner Pro team
results.description:
“Scanner Pro is perhaps the best app for quickly scanning and saving a digital version of a paper document.” – New York Times Scanner Pro by Readdle is a revolutionary application that redefined the AppStore scanning category. It uses a built-in iOS camera to take pictures of a paper document. The unique technology automatically detects the edges, fixes geometry, and removes shadows and other visual defects to make a perfect scan. Also, it harnessed an advanced optical character recognition (OCR) technology that allows you to extract text from scans.
 
Readdle is looking for an Associate Product Manager. We need a team member who is capable of taking innovative, conceptual ideas and turning them into something useful for the millions of Scanner Pro users.



What you will do:

  • Execution of product manager tasks where the product has time shortage to achieve product/business goals
  • Product documentation is maintained in an actual state according to the standard templates (Jira, feature/experiment documents, dashboards)

  • Gather and organize accessible data (competitors' assets analysis, research, analytics, customer feedback) in a form that drives decision-making

What you will get:

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
At Emburse our mission is to help make our users’ lives – and their businesses – better. We are dramatically transforming how organizations manage corporate expenses and invoices. We humanize work by automating manual tasks and saving users’ time, so they can focus on what matters most – their family, community, or more rewarding work. We help CFO’s give their employees a simple and amazing experience while ensuring compliance and reducing costs. Our solutions are tailored for companies from start-ups and SMBs to enterprises such as Microsoft, Pinterest, Bosch, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and Estee Lauder. We have more than 18,000 customers and 12 million users globally.

The Product Manager shapes the overall vision of software products and applications through collaboration with clients and internal software developers, design, account management / sales, and marketing teams.


What You'll Do
  • Responsible for driving product development for a major product focus area spanning more than one full engineering team
  • Collaborate on building business case, defining product vision and strategy
  • Create systems and processes to capture qualitative insights (pain points, performance issues, support tickets, feature requests etc.) and track product analytics (usage, adoption, retention and conversion behaviors) and structure, organize and surface this information to guide product design, iteration and prioritization for maximum business impact
  • Communicate status of project with stakeholders
  • Manage the prioritized feature backlog and bug process
  • Create clear and concise product specs, test, iterate and drive to launch, partnering with Engineers and Designers on product development
  • Drive consensus and identify key metrics for upcoming projects

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
At Human API, we exist to radically accelerate the pace of health innovation for everyone. That is our vision. We unlock siloed health data from everywhere and put it directly into the hands of the consumer, right when they need it: enabling a meaningful transaction that creates value in their lives. Some call us the "PayPal" of health data, but our dreams are bigger. 

To name a few examples, we help rapidly screen participants for clinical trials, enable life-changing software through accurate wearable data, and we accelerate the buying process for important insurance products.  Tomorrow we will inspire the innovation of impactful digital health products to maximize human longevity and potential. We are looking for talent who are equally inspired by these big ideas and have the grit and determination to make them come to life.

As a Product Owner, you’ll support the execution of product solutions for our core vertical markets; Life Insurance and Life Sciences.  This role will translate our strategic roadmap into a clear, functional backlog and then drive the  development of these new capabilities. The ultimate goal of this role is to build and deliver the right features at the right time to maximize revenue growth, client satisfaction and solution adoption.   

Human API is a product led company. This is an opportunity to make a major impact on our company and the healthcare industry at large. 


What you'll do
  • Drive the solutioning process to convert high level roadmap items into detailed epics and user stories that feed our execution backlog
  • Represent the voice of the user and define minimum viable scope for each item on the roadmap
  • Manage the tradeoffs within each epic to balance scope, time and resources while delivering on the epic’s goal 
  • Work with Customer Success and Operational Teams to understand, scope and prioritize customer friction points and product bugs within the context of larger strategic priorities.
  • Write clear, verifiable acceptance criteria
  • Participate in validation of completed stories throughout the sprint
  • Demo completed functionality at sprint reviews
  • Build trusted relationships with cross-functional teams in order to deliver predictable, high-quality outcomes
  • Tirelessly chase down open questions, blockers, and dependencies.  
  • Stay true to our values, including serve the human first; which means prioritizing consumer transparency, trust and privacy


About You
  • 2+ years of relevant product owner or product manager experience working with SaaS, B2B software, or enterprise software platforms
  • Experience effectively working in an Agile Scrum environment 
  • Experience owning a product backlog and prioritizing features
  • Former practice with the process of product definition and validation; delivering MVP products and then iterating to improve them
  • Ready to be in a remote-first work culture and the sense of accountability to be successful in it.
  • Business Minded. Eager and able to connect each new feature to the business value they provide to our customers. 
  • Good product intuition; you can gather insights and synthesize customer needs into clear product requirements and roadmap.
  • The ability to influence people to get things done across the organization, striving to remove complexity and simplify both ideas and communication
  • Familiarity and comfort with the pace of an early stage company


Bonus
  • Previous experience with medical data 
  • Specific experience within Life Insurance or Life Sciences industries
The national, annual salary range for this position is $100,000 to $115,000 commensurate with experience.

We’re built by strong venture backing from Andreessen Horowitz, Blue Run Ventures, SCOR Global, Allianz, Guardian Life Insurance Company, and Samsung Ventures and currently serve some of the largest financial and health companies in the world from Prudential, Allstate, John Hancock, Omada Health, Thrive Global, AAA, and many more. 

We have thousands of API integrations into enterprise health record systems, wearable devices, as well as health and wellness applications, that all benefit the end consumer and our enterprise customers.  We’re looking for independent thinkers who care deeply about the problems we’re trying to solve. At Human API, we welcome people of all backgrounds.

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
SUMMARY

As a Product Owner in our Client Delivery team you will define, prioritize, and evaluate the work based on Client requirements for new implementations, change requests and maintenance upgrades to optimize the business value delivered by your scrum team. You will work with subject matter experts at our customers and within Vestmark to develop the user stories for product enhancements and oversee product enhancements throughout the development lifecycle.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS*

  • Participate in discovery alongside key stakeholders ensuring a significant understanding of requirements to share with the development team.
  • Partner with Products to understand new features
  • Coordinate, facilitate and/or conduct as needed demonstrations
  • Manage Change Request assignments with the scrum team and ascertain priority and timing expectations with the client/RM
  • Manage upgrades and maintenance releases with scrum team
  • Work with internal/external client teams to document business requirements
  • Write internal/external user stories and acceptance criteria and conduct walkthroughs as needed
  • Refine user stories with the scrum team
  • Establish priorities, collaborating with client or internal relationship managers when needed
  • Prioritize interruptions against sprint work
  • Maintain scrum team backlog
  • Creating & Maintaining epics for projects
  • Owning the status of an epic and ensuring they are closed when work is complete

  • Be available for adhoc questions raised by the scrum team

PREPARATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Financial industry knowledge, particularly in the areas of portfolio management, portfolio accounting, or trading operations
  • Familiarity with the data associated with the processing of securities, transactions, and positions of either retail or institutional portfolios
  • Experience with software delivery
  • Enterprise software company experience or experience in a professional services organization delivering enterprise software used by financial services organizations
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong and effective customer service skills
  • Bright with a high degree of initiative to learn and work collaboratively to solve problems
  • Do what it takes attitude, displaying positive energy even in challenging situations
  • Strong communication skills; able to respond and exchange ideas clearly and effectively through writing, speaking, and presentations; shares appropriate information to keep people informed

COMPETENCIES

  • Teamwork – We before me-- Puts needs of team first and aspires to bring out the best in others; collaborative, empathetic and humble; values the opinions of others; assists others when needed; participates effectively as member of a team; balances personal contributions and needs with those of other members of the team to achieve common objectives.
  • Knowledge Explorer – Creative problem solver and adapts to challenges at hand using creative collaboration; curious, proactive and resourceful; able to incorporate other viewpoints as part of the process of developing solutions
  • Positive Energy – Ability to address difficult situations with humor and sense of opportunity; approachable, constructive and engaged
  • Own It- Empathetic and accountable until the end.

WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Willingness to travel occasionally on as needed basis. 

BENEFITS

  • Vestmark pays 90% of Medical and Dental insurance premium
  • Vestmark sponsored Life, STD, and LTD Benefits
  • Generous PTO
  • Company equity in the form of Restricted Stock Units
  • 401(k) with Employer Matching
  • Employee Assistance Program

 

Vestmark is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Vestmark prohibits employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability status, protected military or veteran status, and genetic information.

This role cannot be performed by a resident of New York City, NY.

results.title: Head of Product - Rider Experience
results.description:
Description

About Masabi:

At Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work, and visit by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company developing a fare collection platform that allows people to buy and present tickets for public transit on their mobile phones or by tapping a bank card or smart card to travel. 

 

We believe a new fare payments system allowing passengers to tap and ride without needing to buy a ticket or understand fares should be available to every passenger and every transit agency around the globe, without prohibitive costs or taking years to deliver, helping people move seamlessly from A to B.

 

Our Justride platform has won numerous awards and is used in over 150 locations worldwide, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, Valencia, The Hague, Los Angeles, Melbourne, and many more. With an exciting industry-first mobile ticketing SDK, we are partnering with companies like Uber, Lyft, Transit, Moovit to enable the purchase of public transit tickets within leading mobility applications.

 

Join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.

 

 

The Role: 

We’re looking for a Head of Rider Experience Products to own the products and integrations that Masabi builds to make riding transit an easy and enjoyable experience for our global users. 

 

The primary focus for this role will be Masabi’s app, web portal, and partner integrations across the broader mobility space, with a broader view of the rider's experience across our platform as they plan, use, and pay for transit and mobility services, interacting with both digital and physical channels. 

 

Using a deep understanding of the diverse transit riders and agencies we serve, and working with internal and external partners, you will work on developing a roadmap that creates new value for riders, agencies, and the Masabi business.

 

 

Location: This role is available for candidates in Canada, anywhere on the EST time zone

 

 

Responsibilities: 

  • Define the product vision for the Rider Experience area, identifying near and long-term initiatives to build your product roadmap
  • Set the overall strategy for Masabi Rider Experience products and partnerships, defining the product offerings that agencies need (as well as those they don’t even know they need) and working with customer-facing teams on go-to-market approaches
  • Use your experience with transit apps and data as well as customer experience enablement to innovate on rider journeys and agencies’ ability to serve and engage with them, identifying opportunities to drive ridership, satisfaction, and adoption
  • Develop a deep understanding of the marketplace for rider experience technology, including transit rider needs and challenges, and emerging trends and technologies
  • Understand the specific needs and opportunities of target markets and segments in a diverse global context
  • Identify, evaluate, and execute partnership opportunities that enhance the Rider Experience, managing relationships with current and future partners for your area
  • Oversee successful delivery across your product area, and support notable launches that result in enhanced client and rider adoption and satisfaction
  • Manage complex cross-functional dependencies with product and engineering leaders to ensure a holistic approach across the portfolio and take the lead on advocating for the rider experience across the product portfolio  
  • Build and foster a strong team culture with a focus on execution and results, and provide direct leadership to product managers in the Rider Experience product area

 

 

About You:

  • Solid B2B and B2C product management experience at a global scale, ideally in transit and/or payments
  • Experience with people management, including mentoring and guiding product managers
  • Obsessed with creating magical customer experiences and able to do it at scale, preferably in a transit or payment product context 
  • A commercial mindset with a clear track record of delivering innovative and high-value solutions to hard problems 
  • Data hungry, and experienced at getting and analysing the data required to make evidence-based decisions that drive the right outcomes for our customers and business
  • Successfully launched new apps with high volume and positive customer response in the market in the past, and have managed multiple sizeable product lines
  • Experience working in fast-paced, high-growth organisations
  • Technology savvy, with exposure to front-end web and mobile development approaches, data and analytics, integration and data standards, and customer experience technology

 

 

Some of our benefits:

  • Competitive salary package
  • 20 days of vacation per year (in addition to public holidays), plus the option to buy an additional 5 days of vacation each year. On top of this, our office is shut every year between Christmas and New Year, totalling a whopping 28+ days of vacation
  • Private Healthcare and Life Insurance via Trinet
  • Choice of a workstation
  • CA$300 per year to spend on your home office
  • Ability to work for up to 3 months per year from any country in the world
  • Enhanced family leave
  • Fun and collaborative environment with a focus on making a difference in the world

 

 

Diversity:

We celebrate multiple approaches and points of view, striving to create an environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their whole, authentic selves to work. Whoever you are, just be yourself. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply; we don’t discriminate. Also, please notify our team of your pronouns at any point in your application. 

 

Interviewing:

All interviews are expected to take place by phone or video.

 

Remote working:

Masabi’s flexible working policy will allow you to work entirely remotely, or from one of our offices in London, Cluj, New York, Denver or Boston. The choice about where you work from will be primarily made by you. Regardless of where you choose to work from, you will be allowed to work outside of the country of your employment for up to 3 months each year.

 

To find out more about who we are and how we work, please have a read about how our business reacted to the Covid pandemic: https://www.masabi.com/2021/08/02/emerging-stronger/

Requirements

None

results.title: Director, Product
results.description:
Loyal is an organization centered on experience and building a platform that allows consumers to make meaningful decisions when it comes to healthcare. We deeply understand providers, locations, services, appointments, business rules, and moreover, we understand patients -- who they are, the preferred method of communication, upcoming appointments, lapsed appointments, outstanding bills, health risks, and more. With this intelligence, our platform fuels highly relevant and personalized experiences across all mediums (website, email, voice…) allowing patients to get healthy, stay healthy, and have a better relationship with the health care provider.

**This is a remote role**

Job Summary 

The Director, Product role is responsible for product planning, strategy and execution for our Digital Front Door and Shared Services division of products. Products in this division include, but are not limited to; Conversational AI, Web Search, Web Scheduling, Data Management, EHR Integrations, and Portal Services. 

The Director, Product is responsible for defining the vision for the division and collaborating with other leaders from the engineering, marketing, sales, and operations departments to ensure that financial, customer, and user satisfaction goals are met. This role will also work closely with other Director, Product roles to ensure effective and efficient cross-division coordination. Most importantly, this role is responsible for coaching and growing the product managers within the division.

Job Duties 

  • Develop long term strategy, vision and high-level priorities for your product team(s) in alignment with company priorities
  • Continuously engage customers to gain insight into customer needs and represent Loyal’s products
  • Practice effective internal and external communication, ensuring that priorities, high-profile metrics, and projects are well communicated and well understood
  • Partner with Engineering and Design to foster empowered product delivery teams operating effectively at all levels 
  • Collaborate with Leadership, Marketing, Customer Success, and other functional areas to gain new insights, unlock opportunities, and work together more effectively, with a specific focus on enabling go-to-market strategies.
  • Manage cross-team dynamics to ensure the entire team is successful, proactively instituting process improvements across your team, e.g., review and provide feedback on roadmaps, strategic plans and feature specs
  • Coach team members to use modern, effective, and data-driven product management practices to de-risk decisions and create value 
  • Plan the structure of your team, managing headcount, succession planning, external hires and internal transfers 
  • Motivate your team to ensure they are engaged and connected to the larger company mission

Education and Experience

  • 7+ years of technology product management experience
  • 3+ years of experience managing people 
  • Experience working in the healthcare technology space preferred
  • Strong preference for experience integrating with EHRs
  • Experience working within a software as a service (SaaS) company preferred
  • Experience working within a start-up and/or ambiguous environment, with proven experience to be adaptable preferred

 

Knowledge and Skills

  • Management: You have directly managed a team of product managers
  • Execution: You have led multiple product teams which are able to execute consistently, delivering quality projects of the broadest scope and impact on time
  • UX: You are passionate about creating intuitive, simple user experiences.  You have a strong eye for usability and quality design.  You are a strong partner to and advocate for design
  • Technical: You are comfortable working with engineering leadership to prioritize broadly and you understand technical complexities of your product areas
  • Analytical: You have a good grasp of experiment design, statistical analysis and multivariate testing.  You can use data to set OKRs, create dashboards to monitor product health, review analyses from across the company and develop basic models. You can construct a narrative for using data in order to drive the decision making process
  • Organizational skills: You are able to manage multiple teams with stakeholders across the organization. You have experience working closely with business & marketing partners
  • Communication: You’re a strong communicator, both written and orally. You enjoy working with complex concepts and distilling them down so that anyone can understand them. You’re comfortable working cross functionally with stakeholders and can manage competing needs to drive alignment and resolution
  • Diplomatic: You know how to work with all different types of personalities, and can navigate tough conversations
  • Adaptive: You are curious, optimistic and a skilled problem-solver.  You embrace the unknown and are able to adapt to shifts in priorities.You look outside your day to day to ensure you keep learning and growing

 

#LI-REMOTE

 

We know that potential candidates are often less likely to apply to a position if they don’t match 100% of the job qualifications.  Don’t let that be why you miss out on this opportunity!  We encourage you to apply if you can demonstrate many of these skills and competencies. 
 
Loyal to our employees
 
We are a remote-friendly company! We encourage you to apply from anywhere in the United States. We also believe in a work/life balance that fulfills you while you’re here and supports you when you’re not. We built our benefits package to prove that we’re committed to you having everything you need (including a little fun).  Here is what we offer full-time employees:
  • Flexible paid time off, sick and personal days
  • At least one holiday per month (sometimes, more!)
  • Full health, dental, and vision insurance - Loyal pays the premium for all employees!
  • One Time Home Office Setup Stipend For Remote & Hybrid Roles
  • Monthly Internet Stipend for Remote & Hybrid Roles
  • Long term & short term disability 
  • 401[k] plan
  • 16 Weeks Paid Parental Leave
  • 2 Volunteer days per year
  • Matching Gift Program
  • Participation Grant Program
  • Annual Travel/Team Events up to twice per year (post-COVID)
Our Commitment

We believe that the key to Loyal's success is you. Your unique background, life experience, knowledge, self-expression, and talent make you uniquely you. Who you are, what you have experienced, and how you think inspires us to be innovative and bold.

Loyal is an equal opportunity employer. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, ancestry, sex, gender identity and expression, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, languages spoken, veteran status, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and beliefs.

We consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Further, consistent with applicable federal and state law, Loyal provides reasonable accommodations when requested by qualified applicants or employees with disabilities, unless doing so would cause an undue hardship. Loyal’s policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodation applies to all aspects of employment, including the application process. If you require a reasonable accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact the Talent Acquisition Department at talentacquisition@loyalhealth.com.

E-Verify
 
This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the I-9 Form.   

COVID-19 Vaccinations

Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable law. If you require a reasonable accommodation to Loyal’s vaccination requirement, please contact the People Department at people@loyalhealth.com.

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
Sequence exists to magically simplify financial operations for modern companies.

At the end of your career, we want you to look back at your time with Sequence and say it was the best job you ever had. 

We're remote within +/-5  hours of GMT, or you can work from our Hub in central London.

 

The role

We're looking for a Senior Product Manager who will be at the centre of all the activity at Sequence, helping us build one of the best, most innovative finance operations software platforms of all time.

Working directly with the CEO, Growth team and wider Engineering team, you will be responsible for identifying user problems, defining new opportunities and shipping new product features that will delight our customers.

 

What you'll do

  • Whiteboard new user experiences and optimise the flows.

  • Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders to understand requirements, align expectations and effectively prioritise the product roadmap.

  • Design wireframes and mockups to communicate solutions with Engineering and Design teams.
